info.title: CHIPS Money API Subscribed Service Intermediary Plugin
info.description:
The CHIPS® Money Subscribed Service Intermediary (SSI) plugin allows integrators matching certain criteria to completely manage their user base.

An SSI is allowed
* to authorise money movement on behave of their users.
* fund accounts in real-time. 



Also see:
* [CHIPS BSSI Authentication](../../docs/1-CHIPS-Authorization/20-CHIPS-Basic-Subscribed-Service-Intermediary-Authentication.md)

# Terms and Conditions
By using these APIs you agree to the following terms and conditions
1. [CHIPS Terms and Conditions](http://www.chips.co.za/downloads/CHIPS_Terms_Conditions_2019-07-25.pdf)
1. [AOS Terms and Conditions](http://www.chips.co.za/downloads/AOS_Terms_and_Conditions_2018-06-26.pdf)
1. Trustlink API Marketplace Usage and Authorization Terms and Conditions

schema.title: CHIPS SSI Deposit Notification
schema.description: Payload indicating deposit of funds into the CHIPS® Payment Platform for a specific CHIPS® account.

payeeRefInfo.description: External reference to be displayed on the payees transaction history

amount.description:
Amount that with bewithdrawn. Must be a multiple of R 
10

apimStatus.title: Status
apimStatus.description:
All responses from the marketplace will at least contain the *apimStatus* object.  The purpose is to inform the requester of status details above and beyond the HTTP status code.

Note that it is possible to have a success indicator on the marketplace layer, but have a unsuccessful indication on the *providerCode*. This in essence means that even if the API to the provider returned for example a 'not found' result, the request is still chargable on the marketplace layer.

The *providerCode* will only be present if the API was routed to the API Provider.

## Marketplace Codes

| Code | Description |
|------|---------------|
| 200 | Successfully serviced and charged. |
| 250 | Successfully serviced with no charge. |
| 401 | Unauthorized.  |
| 404 | Not Found. |
| 450 | Application Not Found. |
| 451 | Organization Not Found. |
| 500 | Internal Server Error. |

marketplaceCode.description: Indicates status on the marketplace layer.
marketplaceCode.title: Markerplace layer status code

marketplaceMsg.title: Human readable message to provide more details on the *marketplaceCode*.
marketplaceMsg.example: An API subscription application for the requested URI was not found.
marketplaceMsg.description: Human readable description providing details about the error. On success the value will be 'Success'

providerCode.description: Error code returned API provider. The value is of type string seeing as the prodiver might respond with a string error code like 'ERRDB01'

statusCode.description: Same as the http status code

marketplaceId.description: Marketplace request id for support and tracing queries.

marketplaceMocked.description:
Indicates if the response was generated by a marketplace mockup. This is only relevant to API that start with the /storefront and /sandbox paths. 
If true, the API was not passed on to the API provider backend, but the response is being mocked up the marketplace.
If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

get.description:
Calculate the fees the CHIPS® account holder will have to pay to transfer money to a bank account.

*Supported Branch Codes*

| Bank | Branch Codes |
| --- | --- |
|	Nedbank	|	198765	|
|	Absa Bank	|	632005	|
|	Capitec Bank	|	470010	|
|	Investec Bank	|	580105	|
|	Standard Bank	|	051001	|
|	First National Bank	|	250655	|

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount on which fees should be calculated

parameters.name: branchCode
parameters.description: Branch code indicating the bank involved.

bankRefInfo.description: External reference displayed on the payees bank statement

amount.description:
Amount that with bewithdrawn. Must be a multiple of R 
10

apimStatus.title: Status
apimStatus.description:
All responses from the marketplace will at least contain the *apimStatus* object.  The purpose is to inform the requester of status details above and beyond the HTTP status code.

Note that it is possible to have a success indicator on the marketplace layer, but have a unsuccessful indication on the *providerCode*. This in essence means that even if the API to the provider returned for example a 'not found' result, the request is still chargable on the marketplace layer.

The *providerCode* will only be present if the API was routed to the API Provider.

## Marketplace Codes

| Code | Description |
|------|---------------|
| 200 | Successfully serviced and charged. |
| 250 | Successfully serviced with no charge. |
| 401 | Unauthorized.  |
| 404 | Not Found. |
| 450 | Application Not Found. |
| 451 | Organization Not Found. |
| 500 | Internal Server Error. |

marketplaceCode.description: Indicates status on the marketplace layer.
marketplaceCode.title: Markerplace layer status code

marketplaceMsg.title: Human readable message to provide more details on the *marketplaceCode*.
marketplaceMsg.example: An API subscription application for the requested URI was not found.
marketplaceMsg.description: Human readable description providing details about the error. On success the value will be 'Success'

providerCode.description: Error code returned API provider. The value is of type string seeing as the prodiver might respond with a string error code like 'ERRDB01'

statusCode.description: Same as the http status code

marketplaceId.description: Marketplace request id for support and tracing queries.

marketplaceMocked.description:
Indicates if the response was generated by a marketplace mockup. This is only relevant to API that start with the /storefront and /sandbox paths. 
If true, the API was not passed on to the API provider backend, but the response is being mocked up the marketplace.
If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

post.description:
Facilitates payments into bank accounts from a CHIPS account. 

The following banks are supported.

* Nedbank
* Absa Bank
* Capitec Bank
* Investec Bank
* Standard Bank
* First National Bank

schema.title: chips-request-bank-payments.v1
schema.description: Payload to initiate a money tranfer to any bank account

payerRefInfo.description: External reference to be displayed on the payers transaction history

bankRefInfo.description: External reference to be displayed on the bank transaction
